intro: Dombeya reclinata, commonly known as the drooping dombeya, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, which appear in late winter to early spring. The plant has smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Dombeya reclinata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
